page.title: 11River Chelt: survey
page.content: We tested the River Chelt for speed, hardness of the water, its acidity,and the plant life on the banks.{ . The River Chelt is quite a fast flowing,to be precise 1.2m per second. Some parts of it is deep,and where it is shallow,we can see that the bottom is stoney and muddy. The colour of the water is slightly brown, but clear,and is hard. We tested the pH and found that it was pH9,alkaline.We think this is caused by the water running through agricltural land, picking up fertilizer. The banks are steep with vegetation growing up the sides such as:Sycamore,Elderberry,Willow,Hawthorn ,Nettles,Goosegrass etc. The Seven-Trent Water Authority visit daily to measure the height of the water,which the day we went was 0.5m,and also the water.
